docs.lead_paragraph: In the aftermath of the great meltdown of 2008, Wall Street's quants have been cast as the financial engineers of profit-driven innovation run amok. They, after all, invented the exotic securities that proved so troublesome.

headline.main: Wall Street's Math Wizards Forgot a Few Variables

docs.abstract: While Wall Street's quants have been cast as the financial engineers of profit-driven innovation run amok, the real failure, according to finance experts and economists, was in the quants' mathematical models of risk that suggested the arcane stuff was safe.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are parallels between the current health care push and the attempt 16 years ago, but it’s hard to see today’s Republican Party capitalizing on angry centrism the way Newt Gingrich did.
